title: Norwegian traffic sign font
content:
I don’t think this really belong in the ID Forum as it’s a source I’m after rather than an ID.

I’d like to find a Windows font of the official Norwegian traffic sign font shown in this page from the sign design manual

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924064622im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TRAFIKKALFABETET_5403.jpg)
  
there are further showings from page 39 onwards of this [PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924064622/http:/www.vegvesen.no/cs/Satellite?blobcol=urlpdf&blobheader=application%2Fpdf&blobkey=id&blobtable=SVVvedlegg&blobwhere=1174979504101&ssbinary=true)

It’s very similar to various DIN type fonts, but is (of course) not the same.

I found the sign designs (downloadable in a variety of formats), but with my non-existant Norwegian I can’t find the font anywhere on the site.

I have tried mailing the department, but I’ve not had a reply yet.

All help gratefully received.

Richard

 [‹ Fonts that clip the tops off their a's](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924064622/http:/typophile.com/node/34546 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif font with a small hyphen? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924064622/http:/typophile.com/node/34601 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Richard Hards

comments.content: It’s rather similiar — though not identical, the “a” is quite different — to the face used on US freeway signs. Check out a pretty good emulation of it here: [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924064622/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate")

For the latest digitization (2006, by Jacob Øvergaard) visit [the Norwegian FontShop](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924064622/http:/www.luth.no/default.asp?categoryid=1305&file=va). Something like €75 for the whole package.

Thank you very much Fredrik, that looks perfect.
